title: An Unearthly Child
dialogue_triumphs: The Doctor: 'This doesn't roll along on wheels, you know.'
The Doctor: 'Fear makes companions of all of us.'
The Doctor: 'If you could touch the alien sand and hear the cry of strange birds and watch them wheel in another sky, would that satisfy you?'
goofs: William Hartnell and William Russell interrupt each other whilst examining the clock in the TARDIS.
Before Ian gets zapped by the console, somebody in the studio calls out a cue.
Ian says that the Doctor closed the door, when in fact it was Susan who did this.
At the end of the episode, the caveman's shadow extends too far across the landscape.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: A mysterious time traveler with advanced knowledge and technology.
continuity_notes.current_status: Traveling with his granddaughter Susan, cut off from their own planet.

continuity_notes.name: Susan Foreman
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's granddaughter, possessing advanced knowledge and abilities.
continuity_notes.current_status: Attending Coal Hill School while traveling with her grandfather.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: Time And Relative Dimension In Space, a time machine and spacecraft.
continuity_notes.current_status: Malfunctioning chameleon circuit, stuck as a police box.

continuity_notes.name: Ian Chesterton
continuity_notes.description: A science teacher at Coal Hill School.
continuity_notes.current_status: Involuntarily traveling with the Doctor and Susan.

continuity_notes.name: Barbara Wright
continuity_notes.description: A history teacher at Coal Hill School.
continuity_notes.current_status: Involuntarily traveling with the Doctor and Susan.

technobabble: The TARDIS has a malfunctioning 'yearometer' and a radiation counter.
roots: H. G. Wells' The Time Machine
The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

locations.name: Coal Hill School
locations.description: A school in London where Susan attends and Ian and Barbara teach.

locations.name: 76 Totters Lane
locations.description: A junkyard where the TARDIS is parked, owned by I. M. Foreman.

locations.name: Prehistoric Earth
locations.description: A barren landscape, possibly in Africa or Asian steppes.
locations.current_status: Inhabited by a tribe that has lost the secret of making fire.

untold_adventures: The Doctor and Susan have probably been in France at the time of the Revolution (1789–1799)
The Doctor and Susan have been in England after the introduction of decimal coinage (1971)
The Doctor and Susan have visited the classical era of Greece
The Doctor and Susan have visited Europe between 1581 and the mid-18th century
additional_notes: This episode gained a unique aura from real-life events that no other Doctor Who episode would have.
bottom_line: Twenty-five of the most important minutes in British television. For a 'family series', Doctor Who's debut is a remarkably grownup drama.
